name: Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to classical mechanics. Students will learn about the laws of motion, energy, and momentum, as well as other related topics and applications.

name: Electromagnetism
description: This course introduces students to classical electromagnetism. Students will learn about electric and magnetic fields, Maxwell's equations, and other related topics and applications.

name: Thermodynamics and Statistical Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to classical thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Students will learn about temperature, entropy, free energy, and other related topics and applications.

name: Quantum Mechanics I
description: This course introduces students to quantum mechanics. Students will learn about wave-particle duality, the Schrodinger equation, and other related topics and applications.

name: Mathematical Methods for Physicists
description: This course introduces students to mathematical methods used in physics. Students will learn about vector calculus, linear algebra, complex analysis, and other related topics and applications.

name: Quantum Mechanics II
description: This course expands upon students' understanding of quantum mechanics. Students will learn about time-independent and time-dependent perturbation theory, the hydrogen atom, and other related topics and applications.

name: Quantum Field Theory
description: This course introduces students to quantum field theory. Students will learn about the quantization of fields, Feynman diagrams, and other related topics and applications.
